name: Tomb of the Kings

keyEvents.title: Final Battle Location
keyEvents.description: The ancient underground tomb beneath Alubarna serves as the arena for the climactic final battle between Luffy and Crocodile.
keyEvents.significance: This sacred burial chamber witnesses the defeat of Crocodile and the end of his conspiracy.

keyEvents.title: Ceiling Destroyed
keyEvents.description: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Storm punches Crocodile through several feet of solid bedrock ceiling, creating a massive hole from the tomb to the surface above.
keyEvents.significance: The destruction symbolizes breaking through the darkness of Crocodile's conspiracy into the light of liberation.

description: An ancient underground chamber beneath Alubarna containing the tombs of Arabasta's past rulers and a Poneglyph. The chamber has stone pillars and architecture dating back centuries.

name: Alubarna Bell Tower

keyEvents.title: Vivi Stops the War
keyEvents.description: Princess Vivi uses the bell tower as a platform to make her desperate pleas for peace heard across the battlefield. As rain falls, her voice finally reaches the fighting citizens.
keyEvents.significance: The bell tower becomes the symbol of Vivi's voice being elevated above the chaos, allowing truth to reach her people.

description: A tall tower in Alubarna's capital plaza from which important announcements are made to the citizens. Provides a commanding view of the city and battlefield.

name: Alubarna

keyEvents.title: Earthquake from Luffy's Attack
keyEvents.description: The force of Luffy's final attack creates a massive earthquake throughout the capital city, with buildings shaking and Crocodile's body launching into the sky above.
keyEvents.significance: The entire city witnesses Crocodile's defeat as he's launched into the air.

keyEvents.title: Rain Returns to the Capital
keyEvents.description: Rain falls on Alubarna for the first time in three years, causing the warring factions on the battlefield to pause and look to the sky.
keyEvents.significance: The capital experiences the miracle that ends the drought and signals the end of Crocodile's influence.

keyEvents.title: Civil War Ends
keyEvents.description: Both the rebel army and royal forces lay down their arms in Alubarna as the rain falls and Vivi's pleas are heard.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of the three-year civil war and the beginning of Arabasta's healing.

description: The royal capital of Arabasta, featuring grand architecture, a palace, and a central plaza with a bell tower. Site of the climactic battle between rebel and royal forces.

name: Arabasta Kingdom

keyEvents.title: Rain Returns After Three Years
keyEvents.description: Rain falls across Arabasta for the first time in three years when Crocodile is defeated and his Devil Fruit influence is neutralized.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the liberation of the entire kingdom from Crocodile's environmental manipulation and the end of the devastating drought.

keyEvents.title: Kingdom Saved from Civil War
keyEvents.description: The entire kingdom is saved as the civil war ends, preventing the destruction that would have torn Arabasta apart.
keyEvents.significance: The successful resolution of Crocodile's conspiracy allows the kingdom to begin healing and rebuilding.

description: A desert kingdom suffering from a three-year drought and civil war engineered by Crocodile. Liberation comes when Luffy defeats the Warlord and rain returns to the land.
